column1: What standard defines human-centred design for interactive systems?
What is the ISO definition of usability?
column2: Effectiveness, Efficiency, Satisfaction in a specified context of use.

column1: What does “effectiveness” mean in ISO 9241-210?
column2: Accuracy and completeness with which users achieve goals.

column1: What does “efficiency” mean in ISO 9241-210?
column2: Resources (time, effort) used to achieve goals.

column1: What does “satisfaction” mean in ISO 9241-210?
column2: User comfort and positive attitudes toward using the system.

column1: What does “context of use” include?
column2: Users, Goals, Tasks, Resources, Environment.

column1: What is the first human-centred design activity in ISO 9241-210?
column2: Understand and specify the context of use.

column1: What is the second human-centred design activity?
column2: Specify user requirements.

column1: What is the third human-centred design activity?
column2: Produce design solutions.

column1: What is the fourth human-centred design activity?
column2: Evaluate designs against user requirements.

column1: What is the key point about iteration in ISO 9241-210?
column2: Human-centred design is iterative—repeat until usability goals are met.

column1: Why must users be involved throughout the design process?
column2: To ensure solutions match real user needs and context.

column1: What does ISO say about multidisciplinary teams?
column2: Design should involve a team with diverse skills and perspectives.

column1: What does ISO mean by “address the whole user experience”?
column2: Design must consider emotions, expectations, perceptions—not just tasks.

column1: How does ISO relate to UCD Sprint?
column2: UCD Sprint compresses the four ISO activities into Discovery, Design, and Reality Check phases.

column1: How does User Group Analysis fit ISO?
column2: It specifies the context of use (users, tasks, environment).

column1: How do tasks and happy paths fit ISO?
column2: They are part of producing design solutions that can be evaluated.

column1: How does think-aloud testing fit ISO?
column2: It is an evaluation activity to check usability and UX.

column1: What ISO components map directly to usability testing?
column2: Effectiveness, Efficiency, Satisfaction.

column1: What is the overall purpose of ISO 9241-210?
column2: To guide the creation of systems that are usable, effective, and fit the users' real context.
